instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: hello i have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook pro and its show this error and stuck recovery mode[ATTACH type="full"]61321[/ATTACH]

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: That machine is locked; probably Find My Mac is activated on corresponding Apple ID.

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: pero el problema es que no consigue establecer conexion con los servers de apple, sino al menos dejaria usar un apple id o introducir su contrase√±a

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: Is that when you try to reinstall the OS? What OS is it?

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: Hello! is when the world recovery loading bar ends, i can select lang but after that it shows me turn on wifi for check verification, i turn on and connect my wifi and i got the error after that

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message:
Yeah, it happened to me too.
When the client deleted the MacBook from his Apple account, passed activation step without problems.

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: macbook dont have any icloud account, confirmed with apple support

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message:
How did you confirm that?
Are you in contact with the owner?
Online checking may show if iCloud is ON/OFF; but no information about FMM.

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: i contacted apple support and confirmed owner said apple id is off too

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: If the MacBook has been registered, MUST be deleted completely.

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: yes it is deleted, like 8 times eith apple configurator

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message: is not apple id lock is error when connecting apple server, what is the chip who requedt thid information? wifi? can it be losed serial?

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message:
Can you try to boot external and try to install?
Also perhaps to eliminate wifi, try usbc lan adapter if you have one laying around?

threads.title: error activation screen!
threads.message:
Apple Configurator can't delete that.
I mean to delete the machine from owner account.
Even if is in off state there, MUST be deleted from the account.
He can register it back later.

That error message is very tricky, but is not problem with server communication.
As I said, it passed to me...
